name: config_get-NVRAM-access
notes: Strict validation of all inputs is recommended, and secure functions should be used as alternatives for buffer operations.

name: config_set-NVRAM-buffer-overflow
notes: It is recommended to use secure functions such as strncpy instead of strcpy, and perform input length validation.

name: config_unset-NVRAM-deletion
description: The deletion operation of NVRAM values was found in the bin/config file. This operation is located at address 0x000087ec and is implemented via the config_unset function. The lack of obvious input validation may lead to unintended configuration deletion.
notes: It is recommended to add appropriate permission checks and input validation.

name: config_get-NVRAM-format-string
description: Another NVRAM value retrieval operation was found in the bin/config file. This operation is located at address 0x0000891c, implemented via the config_get function, and uses sprintf to construct a list, posing a potential format string vulnerability.
notes: Use secure string formatting functions and validate input content.

name: HTTP_PROXY-env-access
description: The file bin/busybox was found to access the HTTP_PROXY environment variable. This variable is used for network operations and, if maliciously set, could lead to proxy hijacking.
notes: It is recommended to validate and sanitize environment variables in security-sensitive contexts.

name: PATH-env-access
description: The access to the PATH environment variable was detected in the bin/busybox file. This variable is used for command execution, and if modified to point to malicious binaries, it may lead to severe security issues.
notes: It is recommended to strictly validate the contents of the PATH variable, especially in privileged contexts.

name: HOME-env-access
description: The access to the HOME environment variable was detected in the bin/busybox file. This variable is used for user directory operations and could potentially be exploited for directory traversal attacks if not properly sanitized.
notes: It is recommended to clean and validate the contents of the HOME variable before use.

name: init-scripts-env-access
description: Environment variables or NVRAM access detected in multiple initialization scripts under the etc/init.d directory. Further analysis of each file is required to identify specific variable names, access locations, and security risks.
notes: It is necessary to analyze the listed script files one by one to obtain more detailed information. It is recommended to focus on network-related scripts (net-*, dnsmasq) and system-critical scripts (rcS, boot).
